name: CAE Oxford Aviation Academy Douala (SFA-A)
about: The CAE Oxford Aviation Academy Douala (CAE SFA-A), formerly Sabena Flight Academy Africa, is an aviation school owned by the Canadian group CAE, part of its CAE Global Academy. Established in 2008 by Joseph Barla, Jean-Yves Kotto, and Sabena Flight Academy, it is the first civil aviation university in Cameroon. The school trains airline pilots, flight attendants, and flight dispatchers. It boasts three flight simulators, including one calibrated like a Boeing 737-800 and another for the Diamond DA42. The academy is affiliated with the International Association of Aviation Personnel Schools and offers integrated ATPL training, preparing students for the Airline Transport Pilot license. With a motto of "One step ahead," CAE Oxford Aviation Academy Douala is committed to excellence in aviation education.
services:
["Integrated ATPL
Modular theoretical ATPL(A) course
Initial cabin crew course
Purser or chief cabin crew course
Certified Flight Dispatcher
Load master"]
